questions.question: Numerical differentiation is mainly used for?

answers.b: Estimating rate of change from discrete data

explanations.b: Correct: Numerical differentiation estimates derivative from data.

questions.question: The truncation error in Forward Difference method is of order:

explanations.a: Correct: Forward difference has first-order truncation error.

questions.question: Central Difference method provides higher accuracy because:

explanations.b: Correct: Symmetry cancels first-order error terms.

questions.question: If step size h becomes extremely small, the total error may increase due to:

explanations.a: Truncation error decreases as h decreases.
explanations.b: Correct: Rounding error dominates for very small h.

questions.question: Backward Difference method is especially useful at:

answers.a: The first point of the dataset
answers.b: The last point of the dataset

explanations.b: Correct: Backward difference is used at the last point.

questions.question: The optimal step size in numerical differentiation is determined by:

answers.c: Balance between truncation and rounding errors

explanations.c: Correct: Optimal h balances both errors.

answers.a: Differentiation increases sensitivity to small fluctuations

explanations.a: Correct: Differentiation magnifies small data variations.

questions.question: The second derivative using central difference has order of accuracy:

explanations.b: Correct: Standard second derivative central formula is O(h²).

questions.question: In practical engineering applications, numerical differentiation is commonly used to compute:

answers.a: Velocity and acceleration from position data

explanations.a: Correct: Derivatives give velocity and acceleration.

questions.question: Which method cannot be applied directly at boundary points?

explanations.c: Correct: Central difference needs both sides.
